content.text: Fig. 1.1 shows a piece of glass of thickness \(2.0 \text{cm}\) and area \(0.15 \text{m}^2\)
The density of the glass is \(2.6 \times 10^{3} \text{kg} / \text{m}^{3}\)
Calculate the weight of the piece of glass

The piece of glass shown in Fig. 1.1 is used as the vertical viewing window of an aquarium. The atmospheric pressure outside the aquarium is \(1.0 \times 10^{5} \text{Pa}\). The average pressure on the inside of the aquarium window is \(1.3 \times 10^{5} \text{Pa}\)
Calculate the resultant force acting on the window due to these pressures and state the direction in which it acts
force =
direction of force

Fig. 1.2 shows a vacuum pump connected to the top of a vertical tube with its lower end immersed in a tank of liquid. The pump reduces the pressure above the column to zero and the pressure at point X is \(9.6 \times 10^{4} \text{Pa}\)
Calculate the density of the liquid
density = .........
State what is meant by the moment of a force about a point
Fig. 2.1 shows a large crane on a construction site lifting a block of mass \(14 000 \text{kg}\)
Calculate the moment about A due to the \(14 000 \text{kg}\) block suspended from B
Speed is a scalar quantity and velocity is a vector quantity. State the difference between a scalar quantity and a vector quantity
Write down one other scalar quantity and one other vector quantity

Draw a scale diagram to determine the resultant force acting on the object. State the scale you use

statement

The power station uses some of its waste thermal energy to heat water for houses in a nearby town
State **one** problem of using waste energy in this way if the power station is far from the town
Suggest a way of reducing this problem
State **two** environmental consequences of burning coal to generate electricity
consequence 1
consequence 2
A power station burns waste materials from farm crops to generate electricity
In terms of the momentum of molecules, explain how a gas exerts pressure on the walls of its container
Complete the equation for the final pressure \(p_{2}\) of the gas when the gas is compressed at constant temperature
State and explain how the final pressure compares with \(p_{2}\) when the temperature of the gas increases during compression
statement
explanation
A fixed mass of gas of volume \(V_{1}\) is at a pressure \(p_{1}\). It is compressed to a volume \(V_{2}\)
State the name of the reflection of a sound wave or ultrasound wave
Fig. 5.1 shows an ultrasound wave being used to scan an internal organ of a human body
The ultrasound wave has a frequency of \(2.0 \text{MHz}\) and passes through human tissue at a speed of \(1500 \text{m/s}\)
Calculate the wavelength of the ultrasound wave in human tissue
wavelength = .........

On Fig. 6.1, draw two rays from point O of the object to determine the position of the image. Label the image IJ. Measure the length of the image
image length =

**diminished** **magnified** **real** **same size**
same way up as object upside down compared to object virtual
Fig. 6.2 shows three rays of green light passing through glass blocks
Three rays of red light approach the glass blocks on the same paths as the rays of green light
On Fig. 6.2, draw the paths of these rays of red light to the right of the glass blocks.

The wire XY is moved and there is a deflection on the ammeter that indicates there is a current in the wire from X to Y

proton number
nucleon number
charge

A nucleus of strontium-90 consists of 38 protons and 52 neutrons. Strontium-90 is radioactive and decays by \(\beta\) -emission to an isotope of yttrium. The symbol for strontium is Sr and the symbol for yttrium is Y. Write down the nuclide equation of this decay
The half-life of radon-220 is 56 s. A sample of radon-220 is in a container. After 112 s the mass of radon-220 is \(9.2 \text{mg}\)
Calculate the mass of the original sample
